Description : Representation of the R Abstract Syntax Tree.

Synopsis
class Annotated t where
annot :: t annot -> annot
data Ident annot = Ident {
ident_string :: String
ident_annot :: annot
}
type IdentSpan = Ident SrcSpan
type Suite annot = [Statement annot]
type SuiteSpan = Suite SrcSpan
data Statement annot
= While {
while_cond :: Expr annot
while_body :: Suite annot
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| For {
for_target :: Ident annot
for_values :: Expr annot
for_body :: Suite annot
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Conditional {
cond_guards :: [(Expr annot, Suite annot)]
cond_else :: Suite annot
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Assign {
assign_to :: Ident annot
assign_expr :: Expr annot
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Return {
return_expr :: Maybe (Expr annot)
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Break {
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Continue {
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Repeat {
repeat_expr :: Expr annot
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Switch {
switch_guards :: [(Expr annot, Suite annot)]
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| StmtExpr {
stmt_expr :: Expr annot
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Print {
print_exprs :: [Expr annot]
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Exec {
exec_expr :: Expr annot
exec_globals_locals :: Maybe (Expr annot, Maybe (Expr annot))
stmt_annot :: annot
}
| Fun {
fun_name :: Ident annot
fun_result_annot :: Maybe (Expr annot)
fun_body :: Suite annot
stmt_annot :: annot
}
type StatementSpan = Statement SrcSpan
data Expr annot
= Var {
var_ident :: Ident annot
expr_annot :: annot
}
| Num {
num_value :: Double
expr_literal :: String
expr_annot :: annot
}
| Bool {
logical_value :: Bool
expr_annot :: annot
}
| Null {
expr_annot :: annot
}
| NaN {
expr_annot :: annot
}
| NA {
expr_annot :: annot
}
| ByteStrings {
byte_string_strings :: [String]
expr_annot :: annot
}
| Char {
strings_strings :: String
expr_annot :: annot
}
| Call {
call_fun :: Ident annot
expr_annot :: annot
}
Documentation
class Annotated t where
Convenient access to annotations in annotated types.
Methods
annot :: t annot -> annot
Instances

Annotated Ident
data Ident annot
Identifier.
Constructors
Ident
ident_string :: String
ident_annot :: annot
Instances
Typeable1 Ident
Annotated Ident
Eq annot => Eq (Ident annot)
Data annot => Data (Ident annot)
Ord annot => Ord (Ident annot)
Show annot => Show (Ident annot)
type IdentSpan = Ident SrcSpan
type Suite annot = [Statement annot]
A block of statements. A suite is a group of statements controlled by a clause, for example, the body of a loop.
type SuiteSpan = Suite SrcSpan
data Statement annot
